availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hensley Grubbs Harris (Simpson County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Elizabeth Harris. Married to Malinda J. Harris. Father of Elizabeth Frances Harris, Mourning Harris, E. Harris, Joseph Harris, Hattie Harris, John G. Harris, Amanda Harris, Hensley Harris, Jesse V. Harris, and Catherine "Kate" Harris. Farmer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Moses Harris in Simpson County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 9B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 847.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 21.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 298A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Subdistrict 150, p. 111A.
Find A Grave, "Hensley Grubbs Harris (26 Nov 1804-23 Nov 1893)," Memorial #131478580, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/131478580 (accessed September 21, 2020).
